suncertify.db

Class SchemaVerifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • suncertify.db.SchemaVerifier

  • public class SchemaVerifier
extends java.lang.Object
    Auxiliary class that checks the mapped object-oriented primitive and reference types decoded from the database file bytes, against a normative database schema.
    See Also:
    DBSchema

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SchemaVerifier(DBFile file)
      Initializes this instance state with a delegate that assists in reading and translating the database encoded header.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

    • Method Detail

      • verify

        public boolean verify()
               throws java.io.IOException
        Asserts that the object-oriented primitive and reference types, mapped from the database file bytes, match a normative database schema. If logging is enabled, and the operation concludes without an Exception being thrown, a message is logged to the console.

        This method is a "Facade" that confirms that the database encoded header was already read and translated, and if not performs that operation before proceeding with the verification assertions.

        Returns:
        true if all the verification assertions pass, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there's an error while accessing or reading the database file
